newsitem.title: FRANCE: Arthuis confident on franc, second round.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis confident on franc, second round.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Monday he did not expect the left's lead in the first round of the French election to upset the franc and said he was confident voters would turn out for the centre-right government in next Sunday's run-off ballot.

"I don't expect anything like that and I declare my conviction that there will be a mobilisation for the second round," he told a reporter who had asked him on his arrival for an OECD ministerial meeting whether he feared a franc crisis.
"A message has been sent to the majority (parties) and I think it has been received loud and clear," Arthuis said.
"It was a reprimand," he said, asked how he felt about results showing the combined left-wing ahead of the ruling centre-right coalition after the first round of voting.

Arthuis defended the government's record in cleaning up public finances and bringing in economic reforms and said the key to solving France's 12.8 percent unemployment was by boosting the spirit of entrepreneurship.

"The way we can fight unemployment effectively is by consolidating the enterprise culture," he said. "We are confronted...by globalisation which should be an opportunity for everybody, but we have to lower the constraints which weigh on our companies."
Arthuis was speaking at the headquarters of the Organisation for Economic Co-Operation and Development where he was due to chair two days of talks between trade and finance ministers.
